workflow.name: Ai-powered bug tracking with GitHub issues and Telegram alerts using Gemini
workflow.description:
## Create GitHub issues from webhook input and send alerts to Telegram

This workflow streamlines bug tracking by using a webhook to collect issue reports, automatically classifying and summarizing them with Gemini AI, then sending critical issues to GitHub and real-time notifications to Telegram. Optional manager approval is built in for low-priority reports.

### üßë‚Äçüíª Who‚Äôs it for
This workflow is ideal for:
- Engineering teams needing automated issue tracking from multiple systems
- QA testers or customer support agents who log bugs via custom tools
- DevOps teams monitoring logs or error reports in real time
- Teams using GitHub for issue tracking and Telegram (or any messenger) for notifications

### ‚öôÔ∏è How it works
Webhook Trigger ‚Äì Listens for incoming POST requests containing bug or task data.

AI-Powered Classification ‚Äì Uses the Gemini model to classify bugs as High or Low severity.

Optional Approval ‚Äì If severity is Low, it waits for a manager‚Äôs approval before proceeding.

Bug Summary Generation ‚Äì Passes through a filter and sends the input to Gemini to generate a clean summary.

Create GitHub Issue ‚Äì Submits the summarized issue to your GitHub repository.

Telegram Notification ‚Äì Sends a formatted message to a Telegram group or manager, depending on the path.

### üõ†Ô∏è How to set up
- Replace the GitHub node with your repo credentials and target repo.
- Set up the Telegram bot token and chat ID in the Telegram node.
- Customize the Gemini prompts for your preferred classification and summary logic.
- Define the conditions for ‚ÄúHigh‚Äù vs ‚ÄúLow‚Äù severity based on your data.

### üìã Requirements
- A GitHub account with a personal access token (with repo access)

- A Telegram bot token and group chat ID

- Google Gemini API credentials (or your preferred AI model integration)


### üîß How to customize the workflow
- Swap Telegram with another messaging platform like Slack, Discord, or Microsoft Teams.
- Adjust classification rules to match your business logic.
- Change approval flow to notify a different person or add additional logic before sending to GitHub.
- Extend the webhook input format to support richer data, such as user info or system metadata.

parameters.subject: =Approval to create a issue bug by {{ $json.body.name }}

parameters.content:
## Auto-Create GitHub Issues from Webhook Events & Notify via Telegram üöÄ
Automate bug or task creation using a smart classifier and summarizer powered by Gemini. This setups listens forincoming data, automatically classifies it, and sends a real-time notification to Telegram group.

To make it more robust, consider adding manager approval for the low-severity issues, in case only high-severity issues are meant to be included in Github Repo.

This solution is perfect for teams that receive bug reports or logs from external soruces and need immediate visibility.

You can replace Telegram with your preferred messaging platform.

options.systemPromptTemplate: Please classify the text provided by the user that report bug from our platform into one of the following categories: {categories}, and use the provided formatting instructions below. Don't explain, and only output the json.

categories.description: A bug that disrupt the main user flow.
A bug that didn't impact the user flow but could reduce the user experience.

parameters.content:
## Filter
Ensure that only the relevant value is passed to the bug description summarizer.

## Github
You can change with your repo link.

## Messaging Platform
You can use seperate approaches for Telegram messages based on low or high severity.

Telegram tutorial: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.telegram/message-operations/#send-message
Define the conditions for ‚ÄúHigh‚Äù vs ‚ÄúLow‚Äù severity based on your data.

user.name: Rully Saputra
user.bio: Specializing in software engineering with over 5 years of hands-on experience. In addition to my expertise in web development, I also have experience in creating Hybrid mobile apps.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
